exercises

Class ExerciseJD_31

  • java.lang.Object
    • exercises.ExerciseJD_31

  • public class ExerciseJD_31
extends java.lang.Object

    Exercise6-31

    This program checks if the entered credit card number is valid.

    Example:

     Enter a credit card number as a long integer:
 	4388576018402626
 	4388576018402626 is invalid
    Since:
    12-3-2019
    Author:
    Alex Johnson

      • main

        This method gets a credit card number from the user and uses isValid to check if it's valid.
        Parameters:

      • isValid

        public static boolean isValid(long number)
        This method takes the long "number" and determines if it is valid by running it through some rules. 
        Example:
  isValid(4388576018402626) returns:
 	false
        Parameters:
        number - Is a credit card number in the form of a long to be validated.
        Returns:
        Returns true or false depending on the validility of the credit card number.

      • sumOfDoubleEvenPlace

        public static int sumOfDoubleEvenPlace(long number)
        This method finds the sum of double of every second digit from right to left. If doubling of a digit results in a two-digit number, add up the two digits to get a single-digit number. 
        Example:
  sumOfDoubleEvenPlace(12345678912345) equals:
 	34
        Parameters:
        number - Is a credit card number in the form of a long to be summed.
        Returns:
        Returns the sum based on the equation used.

      • getDigit

        public static int getDigit(int number)
        This method returns this number if it is a single digit, otherwise, return the sum of the two digits. 
        Example:
  getDigit(12) returns:
 	3
        Parameters:
        number - Is a digit to be returned or added together and then returned.
        Returns:
        Returns a digit in single digit integer form.

      • sumOfOddPlace

        public static int sumOfOddPlace(long number)
        This method finds the sum of every other digit in the long "number" starting with the first digit on the right working left. 
        Example:
  sumOfOddPlace(12345678912345) equals:
 	31
        Parameters:
        number - Is a credit card number in the form of a long to be summed.
        Returns:
        Returns the sum based on the equation used.

      • prefixMatched

        public static boolean prefixMatched(long number,
                                    int d)
        This method returns true if the prefix is the prefix for the number. 
        Example:
  prefixMatched(12345678912345, 37)
 	false
        Parameters:
        number - Is a credit card number in the form of a long to be checked.
        d - Is the prefix to be matched.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the prefix matches.

      • getSize

        public static int getSize(long d)
        This method finds the number of digits in the long "number". 
        Example:
  getSize(12) returns:
 	2
        Parameters:
        d - Is ultimately a prefix number such as 37.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of digits as an integer.

      • getPrefix

        public static long getPrefix(long number,
                             int k)
        This method gets the value of the prefix. 
        Example:
  getPrefix(371234567890) returns:
 	37
        Parameters:
        number - Is a credit card number in the form of a long to be checked for a prefix.
        k - Is the number of digits that the prefix takes in the credit card number.
        Returns:
        Returns the prefix of the credit card number.
